content:
I am a PostDoc working at Chalmers University, Sweden. I got my PhD in 2016 from Carlos III University of Madrid. I obtained my BsC in Computer Science in 2010 at UPM University in Madrid and a year later I completed my MsC in Computer Science in 2011 at Carlos III University of Madrid.
My research interests range from computer security & privacy to applied cryptography. Over the last years I have worked on a number of areas in these fields, including Browser Extensions, Biometric or Security in RFID.
Most of my papers and ongoing work are available online however if you should require any copy which is not online please send me an e-mail and I will do my best.
 Download my CV. --
summary: I am a PostDoc working at Chalmers University, Sweden. I got my PhD in 2016 from Carlos III University of Madrid. I obtained my BsC in Computer Science in 2010 at UPM University in Madrid and a year later I completed my MsC in Computer Science in 2011 at Carlos III University of Madrid.
title: Pablo Picazo Sanchez
Latex Gloves: Protecting Browser Extensions from Probing and Revelation Attacks
Two RFID Standard-based Security Protocols for Healthcare Environments
